intro: Vaccinium eberhardtii, commonly known as the Eberhardt huckleberry, is a species of shrub native to the Pacific Northwest of North America. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes many acid-loving plants such as blueberries and cranberries. The plant produces small, edible berries that are typically dark blue or black when mature. These berries are often used in local cuisines and have a tart, slightly sweet flavor. Vaccinium eberhardtii thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forested areas.
